headline: Compared to Estimates, DexCom (DXCM) Q2 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: Although the revenue and EPS for DexCom (DXCM) give a sense of how its business performed in the quarter ended June 2025, it might be worth considering how some key metrics compare with Wall Street estimates and the year-ago numbers.

headline: Dexcom Earnings Beat. Diabetes Device Maker Names New CEO.
summary: Dexcom stock fell late Wednesday as it reported Q2 earnings that topped expectations and named a new chief executive officer.

raw.headline: Dexcom Earnings Beat. Diabetes Device Maker Names New CEO.
raw.summary: Dexcom stock fell late Wednesday as it reported Q2 earnings that topped expectations and named a new chief executive officer.

headline: DexCom’s (NASDAQ:DXCM) Q2 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Medical device company DexCom (NASDAQ:DXCM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 15.2% year on year to $1.16 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $4.61 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.48 per share was 7.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: DexCom (DXCM) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Top Estimates
summary: DexCom (DXCM) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +6.67% and +3.06%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: DexCom: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: SAN DIEGO (AP) — DexCom Inc. DXCM) on Wednesday reported second-quarter net income of $179.8 million. On a per-share basis, the San Diego-based company said it had net income of 45 cents.

headline: Dexcom CEO Kevin Sayer to step down
summary: Jake Leach will take over the role at the start of 2026, with Sayer remaining chairman of the board after the transition.

headline: Ontario Expands Access to Dexcom G7 CGM Under the Ontario Drug Benefit (ODB) Program
summary: BURNABY, British Columbia, July 30, 2025--Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), a global leader in glucose biosensing, applauds the Ontario government for its recent decision to include the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System as part of the Ontario Drug Benefit (ODB) program for eligible Ontarians who manage their diabetes with insulin.*
